tldr: The authors examine the mechanics of dynamic debonding in anisotropic materials, focusing on the behavior of cracks running along the interface between two substrates. They extend the framework of interface fracture mechanics to include rapidly applied loads, fast crack propagation, and strain rate-dependent material response. The study simplifies the problem by considering an instantaneous steady-state, two-dimensional singularity, and provides solutions for dynamic stress intensity factors in various configurations.
